Nate Winn Still learning

Colophon

My name is Nate Winn, and I live in the heart of the Silicon Valley with my wife Jo and my little boy, Owen. Currently, I'm a part of the RubyOnRails cohort at The Iron Yard based out of Atlanta Tech Village.

You'll find me writing about a myriad of topics here, but mostly coding, technology, and design. This has been my virtual home since 2014.

My Setup

This blog is run on Jekyll, built on the Lanyon theme, written in Markdown, hosted on GitHub Pages, and proofed by my amazing wife (you should hire her).

I'm a fan of Apple products. I write and code on a 2011 13-inch MacBook Air and talk and text on an iPhone 5. I also snap pictures on a Canon70D.

My Toolbox

My software toolbox is pretty basic though I'm constantly trying out new tools to see if my workflow improves. I've found that I don't need a bunch of fancy tools to get the job done, just a few really good ones. Here's a list of what I use on the daily.

  • 1Password to remember
  • Airmail to email
  • Adobe CC to design
  • Cyberduck to upload
  • Dropbox to store and share
  • Google Chrome to browse
  • nvAlt to jot notes
  • OmniFocus to plan
  • Sublime Text 2 to code
  • TextExpander to save time
  • Tweetbot to tweet
  • YNAB to budget

Other Essentials

In addition, I couldn't do without The Roost Stand to perch my laptop, Parrot Zik Headphones to block out distractions, and the Apple Wireless Keyboard and Apple Magic Mouse combo. I'm always scribbling down my thoughts in various notebooks. Currently, these are captured in a Barron Fig Confidant. And last, but not least, I tote everything around in a Minaal backpack.

Feel free to reach out to me anytime with comments or on Twitter at @natewinn

Thanks for reading!
